required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dysport® Pediatric Lower Limb Spasticity Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Multicentre, Double Blind, Prospective, Randomised, Placebo Controlled Study Assessing the Efficacy and Safety of DYSPORT® Used in the Treatment of Lower Limb Spasticity in Children With Dynamic Equinus Foot Deformity Due to Cerebral Palsy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to determine whether Dysport® is effective in the treatment of increased stiffness of the calf muscles and to evaluate the safety of this treatment in children with Cerebral Palsy. In addition this study will also check whether Dysport® can lessen the pain caused by spasticity and improve the child's wellbeing.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in MAS Score in the Gastrocnemius-soleus Complex (GSC) at the Ankle Joint of the (Most) Affected Lower Limb
primary_outcome.description: The MAS is a 6-point scale which measures the intensity of muscle tone by measuring the resistance of the muscle to passive lengthening or stretching. Investigator will grade muscle tone in the GSC from 0 (no increase in tone) to 4 (affected parts rigid in flexion or extension).

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician's Global Assessment (PGA) of the Treatment Response.
secondary_outcome.description: PGA Scale of the Treatment Response: Global assessment of treatment response assessed by asking the Investigator the following question: "how would you rate the response to treatment in the subject's lower limb(s) since the last injection?" Answers will be made on a 9 point rating scale (-4: markedly worse, -3: much worse, -2: worse, -1: slightly worse, 0: no change, +1: slightly improved, +2: improved, +3: much improved, +4: markedly improved).

GAS is a functional scale used to measure progress towards individual therapy goals. Individual goals defined for each subject by the physician, and the child's parents (caregiver) where applicable, prior to treatment. Post-baseline, the GAS for each goal rated using a defined scale (-2: Much less than expected outcome, -1: somewhat less than expected outcome, 0: expected outcome, 1: somewhat more than expected outcome, and 2: Much more than expected outcome).

arm_group.description: 10 U/Kg per lower limb. Either one or both lower limbs can be treated. Total volume injected, 2ml per leg.
15 U/Kg per lower limb. Either one or both lower limbs can be treated. Total volume injected, 2ml per leg.
Total volume to be injected per lower limb - 2ml. Either one or both lower limbs can be treated.

intervention.description: I.M. (in the muscle) injection on day 1 of a single treatment cycle.
I.M. injection on day 1 of a single treatment cycle.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children aged 2 to 17 years with cerebral palsy
- Equinus foot position
- Ambulatory
- Intensity of muscle tone equal to or greater than 2 in affected lower limb, as measured on the Modified Ashworth Scale
Exclusion Criteria:
- Fixed contracture
- Previous phenol, alcohol injection or surgical intervention
- Other neurological / neuromuscular disorder
- Severe athetoid or dystonic movements

facility.name: Texas Scottish Rite - Hospital for Children
Club De Leones Cruz Del Sur Rehabilitation Corporation, Punta Arenas

address.city: Region de Magallanes y de la Antartica Chilena

facility.name: Centro de Rehabilitacion Integral de Queretaro (CRIQ)
Hospital Central Dr Ignacio Morones Prieto
Non-public Healthcare Unit at the Association for Disabled People KROK PO KROKU
B i L- Specjalistyczne Centrum Medyczne
Ghulane Military Medical Academy and School of Medicine
Yildirim Beyazit Training and Research Hospital
Istanbul Fizik Tedavi Rehabilitasyon Egitim ve Arastirma Hastanesi

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Each centre that participated in the study was expected to randomise between five and 25 subjects. It was planned to have at least two participating centres per country.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Screening details: A total of 241 subjects were randomised to the study. The safety population included 239 subjects who were treated. Out of the 239 treated subjects, 4 subjects were excluded from the Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population because no MAS score was obtained at the baseline visit and/or at Week 4.

group.title: Dysport 10 U/Kg
group.description: 10 U/Kg per lower limb. Either one or both lower limbs can be treated. Total volume injected, 2ml per leg. Botulinum type A toxin (Dysport®): I.M. (in the muscle) injection on day 1 of a single treatment cycle.

group.title: Dysport 15 U/Kg
group.description: 15 U/Kg per lower limb. Either one or both lower limbs can be treated. Total volume injected, 2ml per leg. Botulinum type A toxin (Dysport®): I.M. (in the muscle) injection on day 1 of a single treatment cycle.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Total volume to be injected per lower limb - 2ml. Either one or both lower limbs can be treated. Placebo: I.M. injection on day 1 of a single treatment cycle.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: No MAS score at baseline and/or Week 4

baseline.population: Baseline characteristic values were based on the ITT population, defined as all randomised subjects who received at least one injection of study treatment and who had a MAS score in the GSC assessed both at baseline and at Week 4.

group.title: Dysport 10 U/Kg
group.description: Dysport 10 U/Kg intramuscular injection on either one or both lower limbs (2 ml per leg), single treatment.

group.title: Dysport 15 U/Kg
group.description: Dysport 15 U/Kg intramuscular injection on either one or both lower limbs (2 ml per leg), single treatment.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo intramuscular injection on either one or both lower limbs (2 ml per leg), single treatment.

measure.title: Gross Motor Function Classification System (GMFCS)
measure.description: Participants were staged according to the following GMFCS criteria: level 1 (walks without limitations (best outcome)), level 2 (walks with limitations) and level 3 (walks using a hand held mobility device (worst outcome)). Only participants classified as GMFCS levels 1 to 3 were eligible for entry into the study.

measure.title: Modified Ashworth Scale (MAS) score
measure.description: The MAS is a 6-point scale which measures the intensity of muscle tone by measuring the resistance of the muscle to passive lengthening or stretching. The Investigator graded muscle tone in the gastrocnemius-soleus complex (GSC) from 0 (no increase in tone) to 4 (affected parts rigid in flexion or extension).

outcome.title: Change in MAS Score in the Gastrocnemius-soleus Complex (GSC) at the Ankle Joint of the (Most) Affected Lower Limb
outcome.description: The MAS is a 6-point scale which measures the intensity of muscle tone by measuring the resistance of the muscle to passive lengthening or stretching. Investigator will grade muscle tone in the GSC from 0 (no increase in tone) to 4 (affected parts rigid in flexion or extension).
outcome.population: ITT population, defined as all randomised subjects who received at least one injection of study treatment and who had a MAS score in the GSC assessed both at baseline and at Week 4.

group.description: Dysport 10 U/Kg intramuscular injection on either one or both lower limbs (2 ml per leg), single treatment.

group.title: Dysport 15 U/Kg
group.description: Dysport 15 U/Kg intramuscular injection on either one or both lower limbs (2 ml per leg), single treatment.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo intramuscular injection on either one or both lower limbs (2 ml per leg), single treatment.

measure.title: Change in MAS Score in the Gastrocnemius-soleus Complex (GSC) at the Ankle Joint of the (Most) Affected Lower Limb
measure.description: The MAS is a 6-point scale which measures the intensity of muscle tone by measuring the resistance of the muscle to passive lengthening or stretching. Investigator will grade muscle tone in the GSC from 0 (no increase in tone) to 4 (affected parts rigid in flexion or extension).
measure.population: ITT population, defined as all randomised subjects who received at least one injection of study treatment and who had a MAS score in the GSC assessed both at baseline and at Week 4.

analysis.groups_desc: LS means for each treatment group and treatment comparisons, as well as the p-values were obtained from an ANCOVA on the change from baseline with treatment, baseline MAS score, age range at baseline, BTX status at baseline and centre as covariates.

LS means for each treatment group and treatment comparisons, as well as the p-values were obtained from an ANCOVA on the change from baseline with treatment, baseline MAS score, age range at baseline, BTX status at baseline and centre as covariates.

outcome.population: ITT population, defined as all randomised subjects who received at least one injection of study treatment and who had a MAS score in the GSC assessed both at baseline and at Week 4.

reported_events.desc: The safety population, defined as all randomised subjects who received at least one injection of study treatment, was used for the analysis of adverse events (AEs).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
